class.name: RigidCollision2D
class.description: Holds collision data from a [RigidBody2D], generated by the physics server during the physics frame in which two bodies first came into contact with one another. The collision data includes the colliding object, coordinates of the collision point (on both bodies involved), both bodies' surface normals at their points of collision, and the impulse that the physics server applied to restore the collision.

method.name: get_collider_position
method.description: Returns the global position of the collision point, on the local body's shape. [b]Note:[/b] Bodies can contact one another in multiple places. This function reports data from only the [i]first[/i] point of contact.

method.name: get_collider_rid
method.description: Returns the colliding body's [RID] used by the [PhysicsServer2D].

method.name: get_collider_shape
method.description: Returns the colliding body's shape, belonging to the specified pair of colliding shapes.

method.name: get_collider_shape_index
method.description: Returns the local body's shape index, belonging to the specified pair of colliding shapes. See [CollisionObject2D]

method.name: get_collider_velocity
method.description: Returns the velocity of the colliding point, on the colliding body's surface. For a non-rotating object, this will be the object's linear velocity. A rotating object experiences different velocities at different points on its surface. [b]Note:[/b] Bodies can contact one another in multiple places. This function reports data from only the [i]first[/i] point of contact.

method.name: get_impulse
method.description: Returns the impulse force that the physics engine applied to the colliding bodies, in response to the collision. [b]Note:[/b] Bodies can remain in contact with one another for multiple frames. This function reports data from only the moment of first contact.

method.name: get_local_normal
method.description: Returns the local body's surface normal, at the point of collision. [b]Note:[/b] Bodies can contact one another in multiple places. This function reports data from only the [i]first[/i] point of contact.

method.name: get_local_position
method.description: Returns the global position of the collision point, on the colliding body's shape. [b]Note:[/b] Bodies can contact one another in multiple places. This function reports data from only the [i]first[/i] point of contact.

method.name: get_local_shape
method.description: Returns the local body's shape, belonging to the specified pair of colliding shapes.

method.name: get_local_shape_index
method.description: Returns the local body's shape index, belonging to the specified pair of colliding shapes. See [CollisionObject2D]

method.name: get_local_velocity
method.description: Returns the velocity of the colliding point, on the local body's surface. For a non-rotating object, this will be the object's linear velocity. A rotating object experiences different velocities at different points on its surface. [b]Note:[/b] Bodies can contact one another in multiple places. This function reports data from only the [i]first[/i] point of contact.

method.name: get_shape_pair_count
method.description: Returns the number of pairs of collision shapes that are involved in the collision between the bodies. Unlike most of the other data reported, the list of colliding shapes can change, while the bodies remain in contact with one another.
